channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: Why I Ditched My Samsung QLED for a Cheap TCL miniLED TV
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: It's about what's under the hood, not the badge.
item.content:encoded: Not too long ago, I wrote that we should all get over our TV brand snobbery. That manufacturers like Hisense and TCL are now bringing the latest and greatest display technology to us at rock-bottom prices, and that clinging to brand power doesn't make much rational sense.

item.title: This $29 Adapter More Than Doubled My Laptop's Network Speed
item.dc:creator: Patrick Campanale
item.description: Multi-gig networking doesn’t have to break the bank.
item.content:encoded: Is your laptop stuck in the Stone Age with standard gigabit Ethernet? Or maybe no Ethernet at all? I had that exact problem, and found the solution for just $29 with a simple 2.5G Ethernet adapter. The kicker is that you have to buy the right one.

item.title: Finally, an iPad Keyboard That Feels Like Typing on Apple's Magic Keyboard
item.dc:creator: Tyler Hayes
item.category: Satechi OntheGo Bluetooth Keyboard With Stand
item.description: The perfect iPad keyboard for people who don't want a full case or to spend over $100.
item.content:encoded: Satechi’s OntheGo Bluetooth Keyboard with Stand has great keys for typing, but its strength of being unconnected to a tablet might also be its weakness. Anyone looking for a part-time keyboard is in for a treat. But if you want a long-term commitment, you should look at a dedicated keyboard case.

item.title: Best October Amazon Prime Deals of 2025
item.dc:creator: Kris Henges
item.description: Get your holiday shopping done early!
item.content:encoded: Amazon's Big Deal Days sales event features deep discounts on a wide range of products, including laptops, phones, and more. We've rounded up the best deals so you don't need to search for them.

item.title: Don't Limit Yourself to One Type of Switch on Your Mechanical Keyboard
item.dc:creator: Ismar Hrnjicevic
item.description: Variety is the spice of typing.
item.content:encoded: Most mechanical keyboard enthusiasts stick to just one type of switch per board. While that’s perfectly reasonable, why limit yourself? Mixing and matching switches can create a more fun, unique typing experience and make your keyboard truly your own.

item.title: 4 New Microsoft Excel Features to Try in October 2025
item.dc:creator: Tony Phillips
item.description: Check out the latest updates in the popular spreadsheet app.
item.content:encoded: Excel is constantly changing, and this month, you can use the enhanced capabilities of Copilot and Python to speed up your workflow, focus on data analysis, and tailor the program to your requirements. Here are four new features to look out for this October.

item.title: I’m a Writer and Creative, and These Are the AI Tools I Actually Use on PC
item.dc:creator: Cianna Garrison
item.description: AI tools can be incredibly useful if you know how to incorporate them into your workflow.
item.content:encoded: I didn't use AI tools until someone told me, as a writer and creative, I should learn to work alongside them. Since embracing AI, I've enhanced my workflow, boosted my creativity, and optimized my time. Here are the tools I actually use daily.

item.title: Here's the Easiest Way to Speed Up Your Old Smart TV
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: You can boost your smart TV with just a few methods.
item.content:encoded: If your smart TV is starting to feel sluggish, like apps taking forever to load, those frustrating menu lags, and generally acting like it needs a long nap, you're not alone. Before you start planning a weekend trip to the big box store or just resign yourself to a painfully slow browsing experience, take a moment to work on the TV yourself.

item.title: Build a Plex Media Server With These October Prime Day Deals
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heinzman
item.description: Free yourself from monthly streaming fees with this discounted server hardware.
item.content:encoded: Tired of paying for streaming services like Netflix and HBO Max? Maybe it's time to set up a Plex media server. The price of entry is somewhat steep, but there are plenty of great home server deals during Prime Big Deals Day (October 7th and 8th), so now's a good time to spend a couple hundred bucks and decouple yourself from all those monthly streaming fees.

item.title: It's Hurricane Season, Here's How I Protect My Computer from Power Outages and Surges
item.dc:creator: Patrick Campanale
item.description: Don't wait until it's too late to plan for power outages.
item.content:encoded: Has your power ever gone out for days (or weeks) at a time? Mine has, and I learned a lot during that time. Here’s how I keep all of my technology safe when the power flashes or goes out completely due to crazy weather.
